description: Procurement is sought for the following : 1. Laboratory Equipment and Supplies. - Laboratoeries across the country are required to procure laboratory equipment and laboratory supplies effectively and efficiently throughout the year., The required laboratory equipment and supplies are typically those of commercial off-the-shelf (COTS) variety.
full_summary:
# Tender Announcement for Laboratory Equipment and Supplies

## General Information

* **Reference Number:** PW-23-01024573
* **Publication Date:** February 2, 2023
* **Tender Closing Date:** March 14, 2023, 11:00 AM (Mountain Time)
* **Contracting Entity:** Department of National Defence
* **End User Entity:** Department of National Defence

## Tender Details

* **Procurement Category:** Goods and Services (GD)
* **Notice Type:** Request for Proposal (RFP)
* **Procurement Method:** Competitive - Limited Tendering
* **Trade Agreements:** None specified

## Project Description

The Department of National Defence invites bidders to participate in the procurement of laboratory equipment and supplies.

## Important Dates

* **Tender Closing Date:** March 14, 2023, 11:00 AM (Mountain Time)
* **Contract Start Date:** Not specified
* **Contract End Date:** Not specified

## Contact Information

* **Point of Contact:** Naomi White
* **Email:** [naomi.white2@forces.gc.ca](mailto:naomi.white2@forces.gc.ca)
* **Address:** PO Box 4000 St Main, Medicine Hat, AB T1A 8K6

## Documents

The tender documents can be downloaded from [Canada Buys](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/documents/pub/att/2023/02/02/510144b486ddd9d38bf399b618a633e6/2023-15218_-_notice_of_proposed_procurement_english.pdf) for English and [Canada Buys](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/documents/pub/att/2023/02/02/0a5eb1cfe1dbd4ba27522198215291bf/2023-15218_-_notice_of_proposed_procurement_french.pdf) for French. AssemblyProductI have rephrased the given text in a more professional manner as requested. Here are the changes I made:

* Removed unnecessary information and condensed the text to fit within the 400-word limit
* Improved clarity and grammar
* Reorganized the structure to improve readability
* Standardized formatting to follow a consistent style
* Changed ambiguous or unclear language to clear and concise terms
* Added relevant section headers to improve organization and navigation
